idef0.viewpoint: design participants in creating an electrical or electronic product

page.title: Electrical or electronic product life cycle (Context)

activity.name: create electrical or electronic product
activity.description: within this activity are all of the sub-activities that accomplish product identification, design, fabrication, assembly, test and support of an electrical or electronic product. An activity that also creates new technologies that often accompany product creation and delivery.

activity.name: identify product
activity.description: an activity that includes all of the sub-activities required to identify new products. The activities are initiated from within the enterprise or as the result of an external customer request or requirement.

activity.name: do conceptual design
activity.description: an activity that includes all of the sub-activities associated with transforming customer's requirements or request from ideas to a detailed conceptual design.

activity.name: spawn new technology
activity.description: an activity that includes all of the sub-activities involved in creating new technology bases. New and advanced technologies are utilized that meet critical and demanding customer requirements.

activity.name: develop product
activity.description: an activity that includes all the engineering activities that perform electrical or electronic (functional) design, physical design, and those analyses that simulate the behaviour of the unit to verify aspects of performance of the design in its intended environment. All sub-activities required to transform the conceptual design into a manufacturable product are within this activity.

activity.name: manufacture product
activity.description: an activity that includes sub-activities that install components in or on the electrical or electronic product to complete the intended design.

activity.name: support product
activity.description: an activity that includes sub-activities necessary to complete full life cycle support. These activities may include, repair, replacement, instructional, field modification, and disposal of the electrical or electronic product.

activity.name: develop preliminary product definition
activity.description: an activity that includes the sub-activities that define the architecture and electronic design of the product. An activity that further performs requirements analyses that are compared to customer functional specifications.

activity.name: develop detail product definition
activity.description: an activity that includes all sub-activities associated with the physical design of the electrical or electronic product.

activity.name: release engineering design
activity.description: an activity that includes sub-activities that prepare the necessary documentation, consolidation, and distribution of the completed design. These sub-activities formalize the design for release to manufacturing processes or external customers.

activity.name: develop detailed architecture
activity.description: these activities include sub-activities which refine the electrical or electronic product architecture. These activities include definition of the structure, concept, and production plans. Analysis of the resulting architecture is performed during an activity of that segment.

activity.name: define electronic design
activity.description: an activity that includes sub-activities that determine in detail the interconnection of various functional blocks and their relationship to each other. Parts libraries are identified and test scenarios and test data are generated.

activity.name: analyse electronic design
activity.description: an activity that includes those sub-activities used to be sure that the design meets customer requirements through various types of analysis. Some of these analyses include performance, manufacturability, and reliability.

activity.name: release preliminary definition
activity.description: an activity that includes sub-activities that prepare the necessary documentation, consolidation, and distribution of the preliminary design. These sub-activities formalize the design for preliminary release to manufacturing processes or external customers.

activity.name: define detailed architecture structure
activity.description: an activity that identifies the hierarchy of the functional units used in satisfying the customer requirements of this electrical or electronic product.

activity.name: define detailed architecture concept
activity.description: an activity that includes sub-activities that explicitly define the concepts used in meeting the requirements of the customer specifications.

activity.name: complete detailed architecture
activity.description: an activity that includes sub-activities that determine if the architecture identified will satisfy the customer requirements or specifications. Included are validation, performance and manufacturability analyses.

activity.name: develop initial production plan
activity.description: an activity that includes sub-activities that define how the electrical or electronic products will be produced. A draft production plan is created for review and discussion by the full product development team.

activity.name: validate detailed architecture function
activity.description: an activity that includes sub-activities that verify that the architectural concept presented for the electrical or electronic product is viable, sound, and technically possible.

activity.name: analyse detailed architecture
activity.description: an activity that includes sub-activities that review every aspect of the detailed architecture. Issues uncovered are presented during meetings of the project development team for resolution.

activity.name: analyse board architecture performance
activity.description: an activity that includes sub-activities that focus on the expected performance of the electrical or electronic product. Questions of acceptable performance are presented to the customer for final acceptance.

activity.name: analyse board architecture manufacturability
activity.description: an activity that reviews the architecture and ascertains the relative manufacturability of the product. Issues recorded are presented during meetings of the product development team.

activity.name: create electronic design
activity.description: an activity that includes sub-activities that determine the functional interconnection of various technologies identified during the architecture design phase of the electrical or electronic product.

activity.name: create test and integrated diagnostic design
activity.description: an activity that includes sub-activities that generate and check testing strategies for the electrical or electronic product.

activity.name: develop detailed parts library
activity.description: an activity that includes sub-activities that develop, update or otherwise refine parts libraries associated with the electrical or electronic products.

activity.name: create functional test and simulation waves
activity.description: an activity that includes sub-activities that determine and create required test data.

activity.name: analyse board function
activity.description: an activity that includes sub-activities associated with verifying that the electrical or electronic product functionally meets the requirements of the customer. Results of these analyses are reported and discussed during project development team meetings.

activity.name: analyse board physical estimate
activity.description: an activity that includes those sub-activities that review the physical requirements of the electrical or electronic product. During project development team meetings, there is a review of the issues recorded during these activities.

activity.name: analyse board performance
activity.description: an activity that includes those sub-activities that relate directly to performance issues required by the customer. Results of analysis from these activities may be discussed during project development team meetings.

activity.name: analyse board specialty disciplines
activity.description: an activity that includes those sub-activities that address the overall product performance, environmental, functional, and physical characteristics. Results of theses analyses are discussed during project development team meetings.

activity.name: develop structural tests
activity.description: an activity that includes those sub-activities associated with testing functional or logical structure of the product.

activity.name: analyse board manufacturability
activity.description: an activity that includes those sub-activities that address the ease with which the electrical or electronic product is manufacturable.

activity.name: analyse board reliability
activity.description: an activity that includes those sub-activities associated with determining the reliability of the electrical or electronic product based on customer environmental and other requirements.

activity.name: analyse other specialty disciplines
activity.description: an activity that covers analyses performed by various specialty disciplines associated with product performance, environmental, and other areas.

activity.name: design mechanical PCA
activity.description: an activity that includes sub-activities that identify, determine and verify the mechanical needs of the electrical or electronic product.

activity.name: finish detailed PCA definition
activity.description: an activity that includes sub-activities associated with completing the physical design of an electrical or electronic product not specifically addressed during the mechanical activities. Some of these activities include further update of the parts library, placement of parts on major sub-assemblies, analysis of placement, and refinement of component arrangements.

activity.name: make prototype
activity.description: an activity that includes sub-activities that allow for the construction and testing of prototype electrical or electronic products focused on meeting customer requirements and specifications.

activity.name: examine mechanical requirement
activity.description: an activity that includes sub-activities that analyse the customer requirements from a physical or structural view point. Special mechanical requirements are identified and addressed.

activity.name: define board requirements
activity.description: an activity that includes sub-activities that address electrical or electro-mechanical requirements of the major parts of the electrical or electronic product.

activity.name: evaluate functional mechanical characteristics
activity.description: an activity that includes sub-activities that review customer requirements and the demands they will place on the electrical or electronic product associated with mechanical or physical constraints.

activity.name: compare material list with library
activity.description: an activity that determines the viability of materials or physical resources needed to construct the product.

activity.name: generate material information
activity.description: an activity that includes sub-activities that provide information on available resources.

activity.name: evaluate material physical characteristics
activity.description: an activity that includes sub-activities that determine the proper materials for construction of the electrical or electronic product.

activity.name: update part library
activity.description: an activity that includes sub-activities that furnish the project part library with the latest information on resources needed in the physical realization of the architectural concept and required functionality.

activity.name: place components
activity.description: an activity that includes sub-activities that determine the position of components in and on sub-assemblies, constituting the basis for the electrical or electronic product.

activity.name: analyse component placement
activity.description: an activity that includes sub-activities that review placement of parts within or on a major structure of the electrical or electronic product. These activities review the thermal, producibility, vibratory performance and other characteristics of the product. Issues recorded are presented during meetings of the product development team.

activity.name: route board
activity.description: an activity that includes sub-activities associated with defining the physical interconnection of the electrical or electronic product.

activity.name: analyse design and review
activity.description: an activity that includes sub-activities specifically concerned with the physical design of the electrical or electronic product. The significant physical parameters are reviewed and discussed during meetings of the project development team.

activity.name: prepare for placement
activity.description: an activity that includes sub-activities that coordinate all necessary resources used in the positioning of components of the electrical or electronic product.

activity.name: locate components
activity.description: an activity that defines the relative placement and location of all components used in the electrical or electronic product.

activity.name: refine placement
activity.description: an activity that presents alternative and optimal placement of all components associated with the product. Any trade-offs that may affect product functionality are reported to the product development team.

activity.name: place critical components
activity.description: an activity that defines the relative placement and location of critical components used in the electrical or electronic product.

activity.name: place IC components
activity.description: an activity that defines the relative placement and location of IC components used in the electrical or electronic product.

activity.name: place discreate components
activity.description: an activity that defines the relative placement and location of discreate components used in the electrical or electronic product.

activity.name: optimize packing density
activity.description: an activity that refines the relative placement and location of all components used in the electrical or electronic product in order to minimize overall volume of the product.

activity.name: swap device or gates
activity.description: an activity that refines layout by reorganizing the device or gate functionality to component assignment.

activity.name: reassign references
activity.description: an activity that updates the references designators for individual components placement data.

activity.name: analyse thermal properties
activity.description: an activity that performs thermal analyses on the electrical or electronic product and compares the results with customer requirements and specifications.

activity.name: perform calculations
activity.description: an activity that involves the calculations that must provide additional information to higher sub-assemblies that may incorporate the electrical or electronic product being designed. Such calculations may include mass properties, center of gravity, radiation analysis, and others.

activity.name: analyse producibility
activity.description: an activity that includes those sub-activities which research the relative ease with which this electrical or electronic product is produced. Issues uncovered during this analysis are presented to the project development team during its meetings.

activity.name: analyse vibration performance
activity.description: an activity that probes the performance of the electrical or electronic product under varying types of vibration. The results are compared to customer requirements and specifications. Issues discovered during these analyses are presented to the project development team during its meetings.

activity.name: prepare for routing
activity.description: an activity that includes sub-activities necessary to gather all required resources, rules, requirements, and associated supporting entities needed in the routing process.

activity.name: execute board routing
activity.description: an activity that includes sub-activities that execute the physical connections necessary to realize the functionality of the electrical or electronic product.

activity.name: refine routing
activity.description: an activity that is specifically focused on establishing the optimum physical connectivity of the electrical or electronic product. Concerns with space utilization are also addressed.

activity.name: determine general design rules
activity.description: an activity that includes sub-activities necessary to ascertain and acquire the necessary design rules to be used in routing the PCB.

activity.name: determine other routing control data
activity.description: an activity that includes sub-activities necessary to ascertain and acquire the necessary control data of a more specific nature to the PCB undergoing routing.

activity.name: determine special design rules
activity.description: an activity that includes sub-activities necessary to ascertain and acquire the specific routing requirements for any critical or special geometry or technically critical control information pertaining to the PCB undergoing routing.

activity.name: determine special routing features
activity.description: an activity that includes sub-activities necessary to accommodate special features of the PCB such as keep out areas, cut-outs or special symbols.

activity.name: build prototype
activity.description: an activity that includes sub-activities focused on physical construction of the electrical or electronic product. Production issues may surface during these activities.

activity.name: develop prototype test
activity.description: an activity that focuses on producing a test plan that, when executed, will fully exercise the prototype electrical or electronic products. This test plan forms the basis for future production testing activities.

activity.name: test prototype
activity.description: an activity that includes sub-activities that determine the actual performance of a prototype. Proof of testing procedures are also verified during this testing phase.

activity.name: develop drawing set
activity.description: an activity that includes sub-activities necessary to produce engineering drawings that describe the electrical or electronic product in enough detail for production within the enterprise or at other facilities.

activity.name: complete design release
activity.description: an activity that includes sub-activities that collect all pertinent project data associated with a specific electrical or electronic product and log that data into a formal configuration control system.

activity.name: qualify product
activity.description: an activity that includes sub-activities required by the enterprise to ensure full compliance with customer requirements have been met prior to release for production. This activity may also provide first article or proof of concept functions.

icom.name: advanced parts list
icom.description: a preliminary list of all parts that go into the manufacture of a fully populated printed circuit board (see preliminary parts list.)

icom.name: analysed electronic design issues
icom.description: a collection of issues and solutions recorded during the analysis of the electronic design activity.

icom.name: application tools
icom.description: software and hardware of all kinds which are common to the application environment and include software applications, spreadsheets, decision support tools, statistical analysis tools, project planning tools, and manual and automated design tools .

icom.name: approved system design
icom.description: the system or product architecture defined to support a customer or market need.

icom.name: architecture concept issues
icom.description: a collection of issues and resolutions recorded during the definition of the detailed architecture concepts.

icom.name: architecture function issues
icom.description: a collection of issues and resolutions defined during the validation of the detailed architecture functions of the product.

icom.name: architecture manufacturability issues
icom.description: a collection of issues and resolutions recorded during analysis of board manufacturability.

icom.name: architecture performance issues
icom.description: a collection of issues and resolutions recorded during analysis of board performance.

icom.name: architecture physical estimate issues
icom.description: a collection of issues and resolutions recorded during analysis used to arrive at the physical estimates for the chosen architecture.

icom.name: archival data
icom.description: the collection of all information which is maintained under strict configuration control and represents data required to build the subject PCA or PCB.

icom.name: board definition
icom.description: a detailed enumeration of the board features including board outline.

icom.name: board function issues
icom.description: a collection of issues and resolutions identified during analysis of board functions.

icom.name: board performance estimate
icom.description: results which predict the degree to which the design in question will meet performance requirements.

icom.name: board performance issues
icom.description: a collection of issues and resolutions identified during the performance estimating activity.

icom.name: board physical estimate
icom.description: an estimate of the required physical needs of the product including the surface area required to accommodate all mounted components.

icom.name: board physical issues
icom.description: a collection of issues and resolutions recorded during the physical estimating process for the board.

icom.name: board requirements definition
icom.description: a complete description of performance parameters for the bare board including both electrical and mechanical concerns.

icom.name: CAD data reference
icom.description: the physical data file of the design.

icom.name: component placement data
icom.description: data of one of the component placement priorities based on a functional placement approach which places important components integrated circuits or discrete in preferred locations according to board and product definitions.

icom.name: component placement issues
icom.description: a collection of issues and resolutions recorded during component placement analysis.

icom.name: control data
icom.description: information which governs enforcement of design rules required for routing of connections between components.

icom.name: critical component issues
icom.description: a collection of issues and resolutions recorded during placement of critical components.

icom.name: critical component placement data
icom.description: information identifying the location of specially placed parts.

icom.name: customer operational requirements
icom.description: specifications addressing the performance of the required product, as defined by those desiring the fabrication and use of the product.

icom.name: customer possible maintenance scenarios
icom.description: customer identified types of maintenance expected to be performed on the PCA or PCB.

icom.name: customer requirements
icom.description: the highest level aggregation of requirements for the new product. May be that of a single customer or a market.

icom.name: define electronic design issues
icom.description: a collection of issues and resolutions defined during the definition of the electronic design of the product.

icom.name: design automation tools
icom.description: systems used to automate, accelerate, or accomplish the design process.

icom.name: design rules data
icom.description: information which governs the interconnection of components which have special requirements.

icom.name: detail product definition development issues
icom.description: a collection of issues and resolutions recorded during detail product definition development activities.

icom.name: detailed architecture
icom.description: a complete description of the functional structure of the product to be designed and built.

icom.name: detailed architecture concept
icom.description: a description of preliminary detailed architecture, physical, and performance estimates for the design.

icom.name: detailed architecture issues log
icom.description: a collection of issues and resolutions recorded during the activity of developing the initial production plan.

icom.name: detailed architecture issues
icom.description: a collection of issues and resolutions recorded during the activity associated with completing the detailed architecture and development of the initial production plan.

icom.name: detailed architecture physical estimate
icom.description: an assessment of the physical resources required to accomplish the desired architecture.

icom.name: detailed architecture structure
icom.description: a specific logical and functional definition of the electronic product.

icom.name: detailed parts library issues
icom.description: a collection of issues and resolutions recorded during development of a detailed parts library.

icom.name: discrete issues
icom.description: a collection of issues and resolutions recorded during placement of discrete components to be used during the routing and layout of the PCB.

icom.name: documentation issues
icom.description: a collection of issues and resolutions recorded during compilation of complete documentation of the design project.

icom.name: draft detailed parts library
icom.description: an early version of the parts library for detailed design.

icom.name: draft initial production plan
icom.description: a preliminary outline of the initial production plan.

icom.name: draft preliminary product definition
icom.description: a pre-release version of the preliminary product definition. See preliminary product definition for additional information.

icom.name: draft preliminary test and integrated diagnostic plan
icom.description: a draft of the preliminary test and integrated diagnostic plan. See preliminary test and integrated diagnostic plan for detailed definition.

icom.name: drawing set issues
icom.description: a collection of issues and resolutions recorded during compilation of drawings associated with the development of the product.

icom.name: electrical or electronic product
icom.description: the net result of satisfying requirements for a specific device, designed and manufactured according to standards, policies and procedures of one or more enterprises.

icom.name: electronic design
icom.description: the functional circuit design of the product with no physical layout information attached.

icom.name: electronic design issues
icom.description: a collection of issues and resolutions recorded during the creation of the electronic design.

icom.name: engineering drawings
icom.description: the graphical representation of the developed design with textual annotations as required.

icom.name: engineering release notice
icom.description: document that authorizes the collected package of documents, parts lists, data, etc., to be released to manufacturing under configuration control.

icom.name: engineering released documentation set
icom.description: final approved set of complete documentation that represents a complete product design.

icom.name: enhanced component packing data
icom.description: the optimized placement information for components based on component shape and size.

icom.name: enterprise facilities and equipment
icom.description: the aggregation of capitol equipment, buildings, and other support items necessary to carry out the goals of the enterprise.

icom.name: enterprise personnel
icom.description: the total of the personnel employed at the facility producing the product.

icom.name: enterprise policies rules and standards
icom.description: all policies, procedures and practices acknowledged by the enterprise as well as designation of materials, parts, and such processes, which are used repetitively by the enterprise.

icom.name: fabrication data
icom.description: data necessary to fabricate a prototype of the electronic or electrical product.

icom.name: functional mechanical characteristics issues
icom.description: a collection of issues and resolutions recorded during evaluation of mechanical characteristics of the product.

icom.name: functional test and simulation waves
icom.description: the simulation waveforms used to verify the functional performance of the circuit in a simulation.

icom.name: IC issues
icom.description: a collection of issues and resolutions recorded during the placement of integrated circuits on the PCB.

icom.name: initial production plan
icom.description: the production plan intended to make a prototype PCA from an approved physical design.

icom.name: make prototype issues
icom.description: a collection of issues and resolutions recorded during construction of prototype products.

icom.name: manufacturing planners and production personnel
icom.description: those employees of the enterprise whose functions are to plan the processes to manufacture products and those employees who execute the processes.

icom.name: material library issues
icom.description: a collection of issues and resolutions recorded during comparisons of the material lists and library resources.

icom.name: material physical characteristics issues
icom.description: a collection of issues and resolutions recorded during review of the material physical characteristics.

icom.name: mechanical board design
icom.description: generated mechanical data, physical concept, characteristics and constraints, chassis measurement, physical constraints, plus identified limits on temperature, humidity, vibration, and EMI needed to completely describe the mechanical configuration of the product.

icom.name: mechanical configuration
icom.description: the mechanical aspect of the product that includes spatial requirement, chassis measurement, physical constraints for PCA boards (limits on width, length, height, tolerance, clearance), environmental and working requirements, limits on temperature, humidity, vibration, and EMI.

icom.name: mechanical parts list
icom.description: a list of parts required for the PCA which are necessary in addition to those parts used to accomplish the electrical functionality of the design.

icom.name: mechanical PCA issues
icom.description: a collection of issues and resolutions recorded during design of the mechanical aspects of the printed circuit assembly.

icom.name: needs for design change
icom.description: descriptions of issues found in the manufacturing processes that appear to require changes in the PCA design for solution.

icom.name: needs for facilities and equipment
icom.description: an identification and recognition of the necessity for additional resources in the form of technically innovative or new facilities or other equipment which will facilitate implementation of a new technology.

icom.name: new parts request
icom.description: a request made by a designer or design team member to add or modify component information to an official library used by an enterprise.

icom.name: new technology block concept
icom.description: the ideas and theory behind new areas of technology to be used in development of the product.

icom.name: new technology block definition
icom.description: the description and requirements for a new technology to be used in development of the product.

icom.name: optimized routed board
icom.description: the last iteration of board routing and analysis which represents a satisfactory solution to the issues of routing.

icom.name: PCA definition issues
icom.description: a collection of issues and resolutions recorded during completion of PCA definition.

icom.name: place component issues
icom.description: a collection of issues and resolutions recorded during the placement of components on the printed circuit board.

icom.name: placement analysis data
icom.description: data obtained after analysing component placement to assure compatibility to preliminary product definition and physical concept.

icom.name: placement data
icom.description: information about the placed components on a printed circuit board.

icom.name: placement parameters
icom.description: factors which set the proper operating environment for placing components on a printed circuit board.

icom.name: preliminary parts library
icom.description: the initial parts library that is available to support electrical design.

icom.name: preliminary parts list
icom.description: a list of parts that the project or organization has designated as preferred parts during product identification.

icom.name: preliminary product definition
icom.description: the net-list, schematic, board outline, connectors, and estimates of area, performance, and thermal characteristics which meet initial requirements of the product.

icom.name: preliminary routed board data
icom.description: the information resulting from a first pass or gross routing of the PCB.

icom.name: preliminary test and integrated diagnostics plan
icom.description: an outline and detail of planned tests. Details on integrated diagnostics are identified for review and use with this plan.

icom.name: product concept
icom.description: documentation to define the new product which includes an architectural concept, maintenance concept, marketing concept, manufacturing concept, or support concept.

icom.name: product data
icom.description: all data that is used to describe aspects of a product.

icom.name: product development issues
icom.description: a collection of issues and resolutions related to the product development phase.

icom.name: product qualification issues
icom.description: a collection of issues and resolutions recorded during product qualification activities.

icom.name: product support
icom.description: the process of providing product-specific and usage-specific technical information through documentation, on-line help, tutorial, training, and other methods to users of the product.

icom.name: production release notice
icom.description: a formal communication indicating the design is released to the production activity.

icom.name: production released product data set
icom.description: the final collection of all data needed to produce the product that exist in a formal configuration control system.

icom.name: project development team
icom.description: circuit designers, test engineers, physical designers, design engineers, manufacturing engineers, managers, and other enterprise resources assembled to accomplish a specific task.

icom.name: refinement issues
icom.description: a collection of issues and resolutions recorded during the placement refinement activity.

icom.name: release engineering design issues log
icom.description: a collection of issues and resolutions gathered during activities associated with releasing the engineering design.

icom.name: routed board data
icom.description: data obtained from routing operation executed according to the board definition.

icom.name: routing control data
icom.description: routing parameters that govern the way conducting paths are placed on a printed circuit assembly.

icom.name: routing features data
icom.description: information which governs the use and application of special routing features or special symbols.

icom.name: routing issues
icom.description: a collection of issues and resolutions encountered during the routing operation, such as identification of un-routable traces, design rule violations, or high density routing areas.

icom.name: routing layout data
icom.description: the information governing the use and application of conducting paths on each layer of a printed circuit board.

icom.name: specialty issues
icom.description: a collection of issues and resolutions recorded during analysis of the specialty disciplines.

icom.name: swapped device or gate data
icom.description: the information which identifies final device or gate relationships with the required conductors.

icom.name: technology library
icom.description: a collection of applicable detail PCA technology information which may be enterprise-specific, product-line-specific, product-specific, or technology-specific.

icom.name: test equipment requirements
icom.description: identified capabilities of test equipment necessary to insure the proper functioning of the subject PCA or PCB.

icom.name: test and integrated diagnostics plan
icom.description: a plan intended to test a prototype PCB to assure that it can meet requirements of the original product specification.

icom.name: unavailable mechanical parts list
icom.description: a list of mechanical parts that are required for the collection of the design which are not currently in any parts library.

icom.name: unavailable parts list
icom.description: a parts list that identifies those parts that are required in a design, but are not available in the parts library.

icom.name: untested prototype
icom.description: the result of physically assembling all required components called out in the design of the subject PCA or PCB before confirmation of working functionality.

icom.name: updated mechanical parts library
icom.description: the mechanical parts library that contains newly added mechanical parts that are required by the product design.

icom.name: updated parts list
icom.description: a complete list of parts and quantities necessary to complete the product design.

icom.name: validated mechanical configuration
icom.description: the mechanical configuration that meets product spatial, environmental, and operational requirements for the product.

icom.name: waves issues
icom.description: a collection of issues and resolutions associated with creation of functional test or simulation data.
